sbs.gamelogic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • sbs.gamelogic.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AIBoard, HumanBoard

    public abstract class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for the game boards. Human and AI versions extend this in different ways. Has methods that are necessary for keeping track and manipulating the game state. * @author Sampo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean acceptClick
      Whether mouse clicks on the GUI on this board register or not, essentially equivalent to whose turn it is in the game.
      protected int[][] board
      the actual board is an int[][] array that represents the rows and columns.
      protected int column 
      protected int row 
      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Ship> ships
      A hashmap of the ships on the board.

    • Field Detail

      • board

        protected int[][] board
        the actual board is an int[][] array that represents the rows and columns. The cell values represent the following: 0 = empty cell 10 = empty cell that has been shot 2-9 = segment of a ship with that size, e.g value of 3 means a section of a 3-length ship is in this cell 12-19 = segment of a ship with size 2-9 as above, that has been shot at.

      • ships

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Ship> ships
        A hashmap of the ships on the board. The key is the length of a ship, since there's only one ship of each size.

      • row

        protected int row

      • column

        protected int column

      • acceptClick

        protected boolean acceptClick
        Whether mouse clicks on the GUI on this board register or not, essentially equivalent to whose turn it is in the game.

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard()
        Removes all ships from the board and sets the value 0 to all cells Used every time a new game begins.

      • howManySunkenShips

        public int howManySunkenShips()
        Returns:
        returns the number of destroyed ships. Used for checking whether the game is over.
